containers.description: Environment-driven JWT authentication for Cloudflare Workers with secret-name indirection
containers.name: @chrislyons-dev/flarelette-jwt

containers.description: Environment-driven JWT authentication for Cloudflare Workers Python with secret-name indirection
containers.name: flarelette-jwt

components.description:
CLI utility for generating JWT secrets.

This script provides options to generate secrets in various formats, including JSON and dotenv.
It is designed to be executed as a standalone Node.js script. | Configuration utilities for JWT operations.

This module provides functions to read environment variables and derive JWT-related configurations.
It includes support for both symmetric (HS512) and asymmetric (EdDSA) algorithms. | JWT signing utilities.

This module provides functions to sign JWT tokens using either HS512 or EdDSA algorithms.
It supports custom claims and configuration overrides.
components.name: core

components.description:
Explicit configuration API for JWT operations.

This module provides functions that accept explicit configuration objects
instead of relying on environment variables or global state. Use this API
when you need full control over configuration, especially in development
environments or when working with multiple JWT configurations.
components.name: explicit

components.description:
High-level JWT utilities for creating, delegating, verifying, and authorizing JWT tokens | Key generation utility for EdDSA keys.

This script generates EdDSA key pairs and exports them in JWK format.
It is designed to be executed as a standalone Node.js script. | Secret generation and validation utilities.

This module provides functions to generate secure secrets and validate base64url-encoded secrets.
It ensures compatibility with JWT signing requirements. | Utility functions for JWT operations.

This module provides helper functions for parsing JWTs, checking expiration, and mapping OAuth scopes.
It is designed to support core JWT functionalities.
components.name: util

components.description:
Entry point for the flarelette-jwt library.

This module re-exports core functionalities, including signing, verification, utilities, and type definitions.
It serves as the main interface for library consumers.
components.name: main

components.description:
JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) utilities.

This module provides functions to fetch and manage JWKS, including caching and key lookup by key ID (kid).
It supports integration with external JWKS services.
components.name: jwks

components.description:
Type definitions for JWT operations.

This module defines types for JWT headers, payloads, profiles, and related structures.
It ensures type safety and consistency across the library.
components.name: types

components.description:
JWT verification utilities.

This module provides functions to verify JWT tokens using either HS512 or EdDSA algorithms.
It supports integration with JWKS services and thumbprint pinning.
components.name: verify

components.description:
Adapters for Cloudflare Workers Environment

This module provides utilities to adapt Cloudflare Workers environment variables
for use with the Flarelette JWT library.
components.name: adapters

components.description:
Environment Configuration for JWT Operations

This module provides functions to read environment variables and derive JWT-related configurations.
It supports both symmetric (HS512) and asymmetric (EdDSA) algorithms.
components.name: util

components.description:
Explicit Configuration API for JWT Operations

This module provides functions that accept explicit configuration objects
instead of relying on environment variables or global state. Use this API
when you need full control over configuration, especially in development
environments or when working with multiple JWT configurations.
components.name: explicit

code.description:
Create a delegated JWT token following RFC 8693 actor claim pattern

Mints a new short-lived token for use within service boundaries where a service
acts on behalf of the original end user. This implements zero-trust delegation:
- Preserves original user identity (sub) and permissions
- Identifies the acting service via 'act' claim
- Prevents permission escalation by copying original permissions

Pattern: "I'm <actorService> doing work on behalf of <original user>"
code.name: createDelegatedToken

documentation.summary:
Create a delegated JWT token following RFC 8693 actor claim pattern

Mints a new short-lived token for use within service boundaries where a service
acts on behalf of the original end user. This implements zero-trust delegation:
- Preserves original user identity (sub) and permissions
- Identifies the acting service via 'act' claim
- Prevents permission escalation by copying original permissions

Pattern: "I'm <actorService> doing work on behalf of <original user>"

code.returnDescription: Signed JWT token string with delegation claim

parameters.name: originalPayload
parameters.description: - The verified JWT payload from external auth (e.g., Auth0)

parameters.name: actorService
parameters.description: - Identifier of the service creating this delegated token

parameters.name: opts
parameters.type: Partial<{ iss: string; aud: string | string[]; ttlSeconds: number; }>
parameters.description: - Optional overrides for iss, aud, ttlSeconds

code.description:
Resolve verification key from configured sources

Implements key resolution strategy pattern:
- Strategy 1: HS512 shared secret
- Strategy 2: Inline public JWK
- Strategy 3: Service binding JWKS
- Strategy 4: HTTP JWKS URL
code.name: resolveVerificationKey

documentation.summary:
Resolve verification key from configured sources

Implements key resolution strategy pattern:
- Strategy 1: HS512 shared secret
- Strategy 2: Inline public JWK
- Strategy 3: Service binding JWKS
- Strategy 4: HTTP JWKS URL

code.description: JWT token header structure.
code.name: JwtHeader

documentation.summary: JWT token header structure.
documentation.details:
Standard JWT header (RFC 7519) with algorithm and optional key ID.
The `kid` field enables key rotation in EdDSA mode by identifying which
public key in a JWKS should be used for verification. Required for production
EdDSA deployments with multiple active keys.

code.description: Actor claim for service delegation (RFC 8693).
code.name: ActorClaim

documentation.summary: Actor claim for service delegation (RFC 8693).
documentation.details:
Identifies a service acting on behalf of another principal.
Can be nested for delegation chains.

Structure:
    sub: Service identifier acting on behalf of original subject
    iss: The issuer of the actor token.
    act: Nested ActorClaim with same structure (recursive delegation chain)

code.description: JWT token payload/claims structure.
code.name: JwtPayload

documentation.summary: JWT token payload/claims structure.
documentation.details:
Includes standard JWT claims, OIDC claims, and common custom claims.
Note: At runtime, can contain any string key with JwtValue-compatible values,
but only defined fields get type checking.

code.description: JWT Profile structure matching flarelette-jwt.profile.schema.json.
code.name: JwtProfile

documentation.summary: JWT Profile structure matching flarelette-jwt.profile.schema.json.
documentation.details:
Represents the complete configuration profile for JWT operations.
Environment-driven: populated from JWT_* environment variables via profile() function.
Validates against the JSON Schema at project root for consistency across languages.

documentation.summary: Common JWT configuration from environment variables.
documentation.details:
Subset of JwtProfile containing the fields shared across all operations
(signing, verification, policy checks). Extracted by common() function
and merged with algorithm-specific configuration in profile().

metadata.typeDefinition: str | int | float | bool | list[str] | dict[str, Any] | None

code.description: Base JWT configuration shared by HS512 and EdDSA modes.
code.name: BaseJwtConfig

documentation.summary: Base JWT configuration shared by HS512 and EdDSA modes.
documentation.details:
Attributes:
    iss: Token issuer (iss claim)
    aud: Token audience (aud claim) - can be string or list
    ttl_seconds: Token lifetime in seconds (default: 900 = 15 minutes)
    leeway: Clock skew tolerance in seconds for verification (default: 90)

code.description: HS512 (HMAC-SHA512) symmetric configuration.
code.name: HS512Config

documentation.summary: HS512 (HMAC-SHA512) symmetric configuration.
documentation.details:
Uses a shared secret for both signing and verification.

Attributes:
    alg: Must be 'HS512'
    secret: Shared secret key as bytes (minimum 32 bytes)

code.description: EdDSA (Ed25519) asymmetric configuration for signing.
code.name: EdDSASignConfig

documentation.summary: EdDSA (Ed25519) asymmetric configuration for signing.
documentation.details:
Uses a private key to sign tokens.

Attributes:
    alg: Must be 'EdDSA'
    private_jwk: Private JWK dictionary for signing
    kid: Key ID to include in JWT header (optional)

code.description: EdDSA (Ed25519) asymmetric configuration for verification.
code.name: EdDSAVerifyConfig

documentation.summary: EdDSA (Ed25519) asymmetric configuration for verification.
documentation.details:
Uses a public key to verify tokens.

Attributes:
    alg: Must be 'EdDSA'
    public_jwk: Public JWK dictionary for verification

code.description: Authorization options for check_auth_with_config.
code.name: AuthzOptsWithConfig

documentation.summary: Authorization options for check_auth_with_config.
documentation.details:
Attributes:
    require_all_permissions: All permissions must be present
    require_any_permission: At least one permission must be present
    require_roles_all: All roles must be present
    require_roles_any: At least one role must be present
    predicates: Custom predicate functions that must all return True

code.description: Authenticated user information.
code.name: AuthUser

documentation.summary: Authenticated user information.
documentation.details:
Returned when a token passes both verification and authorization.

Attributes:
    sub: Subject identifier
    permissions: List of permission strings
    roles: List of role strings
    jti: JWT ID
    payload: Complete JWT payload

code.description: Encode bytes to base64url without padding.
code.name: _b64url

documentation.summary: Encode bytes to base64url without padding.

code.description: Decode base64url string (with or without padding).
code.name: _b64url_decode

documentation.summary: Decode base64url string (with or without padding).

code.description: Sign a JWT token with explicit configuration.
code.name: sign_with_config

documentation.summary: Sign a JWT token with explicit configuration.
examples:
HS512 mode:
    >>> config: HS512Config = {
    ...     'alg': 'HS512',
    ...     'secret': b'your-32-byte-secret-here...',
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'api.example.com',
    ...     'ttl_seconds': 900
    ... }
    >>> token = await sign_with_config({'sub': 'user123'}, config)

    EdDSA mode:
    >>> config: EdDSASignConfig = {
    ...     'alg': 'EdDSA',
    ...     'private_jwk': {'kty': 'OKP', 'crv': 'Ed25519', 'd': '...', 'x': '...'},
    ...     'kid': 'ed25519-2025-01',
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'api.example.com'
    ... }
    >>> token = await sign_with_config({'sub': 'user123'}, config)

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Claims to include in the token

code.description: Verify a JWT token with explicit configuration.
code.name: verify_with_config

documentation.summary: Verify a JWT token with explicit configuration.
examples:
HS512 mode:
    >>> config: HS512Config = {
    ...     'alg': 'HS512',
    ...     'secret': b'your-32-byte-secret-here...',
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'api.example.com'
    ... }
    >>> payload = await verify_with_config(token, config)

    EdDSA mode:
    >>> config: EdDSAVerifyConfig = {
    ...     'alg': 'EdDSA',
    ...     'public_jwk': {'kty': 'OKP', 'crv': 'Ed25519', 'x': '...'},
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'api.example.com'
    ... }
    >>> payload = await verify_with_config(token, config)

code.returnDescription: Payload if valid, None if invalid

code.description: Create a signed JWT token with explicit configuration.
code.name: create_token_with_config

documentation.summary: Create a signed JWT token with explicit configuration.
documentation.details: Higher-level wrapper around sign_with_config for convenience.

parameters.name: claims
parameters.description: Claims to include in the token

code.description: Create a delegated JWT token with explicit configuration.
code.name: create_delegated_token_with_config

documentation.summary: Create a delegated JWT token with explicit configuration.
documentation.details: Implements RFC 8693 actor claim pattern for service-to-service delegation.
examples:
>>> config: HS512Config = {
    ...     'alg': 'HS512',
    ...     'secret': b'my-secret...',
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'internal-api'
    ... }
    >>> # Gateway receives Auth0 token and creates delegated token
    >>> auth0_payload = await verify_auth0_token(external_token)
    >>> internal_token = await create_delegated_token_with_config(
    ...     auth0_payload,
    ...     'gateway-service',
    ...     config
    ... )

code.returnDescription: Signed JWT token string with delegation claim

parameters.name: original_payload
parameters.description: The verified JWT payload from external auth

parameters.name: actor_service
parameters.description: Identifier of the service creating this delegated token

code.description: Verify and authorize a JWT token with explicit configuration.
code.name: check_auth_with_config

documentation.summary: Verify and authorize a JWT token with explicit configuration.
examples:
>>> config: HS512Config = {
    ...     'alg': 'HS512',
    ...     'secret': b'my-secret...',
    ...     'iss': 'https://gateway.example.com',
    ...     'aud': 'api.example.com'
    ... }
    >>> user = await check_auth_with_config(token, config, {
    ...     'require_all_permissions': ['read:data'],
    ...     'require_any_permission': ['admin', 'editor']
    ... })
    >>> if user:
    ...     print('Authorized user:', user['sub'])

code.returnDescription: AuthUser if valid and authorized, None otherwise

code.description: Authenticated user information returned by check_auth.
code.name: AuthUser

documentation.summary: Authenticated user information returned by check_auth.
documentation.details:
Returned when a token passes both verification (signature valid, not expired)
and authorization (all policy requirements met). Contains extracted identity
and permission information for use in downstream authorization decisions.
Never returned on verification/authorization failure - check_auth returns None instead.

code.description: Builder interface for creating JWT authorization policies.
code.name: PolicyBuilder

documentation.summary: Builder interface for creating JWT authorization policies.
documentation.details:
Fluent API for composing authorization requirements used by check_auth().
Chain methods to combine multiple requirements (all must pass for authorization).
Enables readable, declarative policy definitions that separate authorization
logic from business logic.

code.description: Create a signed JWT token with optional claims.
code.name: create_token

documentation.summary: Create a signed JWT token with optional claims.

parameters.name: claims
parameters.description: Claims to include in the token (can include custom claims beyond standard JWT fields)

code.description: Create a delegated JWT token following RFC 8693 actor claim pattern.
code.name: create_delegated_token

documentation.summary: Create a delegated JWT token following RFC 8693 actor claim pattern.
documentation.details: Mints a new short-lived token for use within service boundaries where a service acts on behalf of the original end user. This implements zero-trust delegation: - Preserves original user identity (sub) and permissions - Identifies the acting service via 'act' claim - Prevents permission escalation by copying original permissions  Pattern: "I'm <actor_service> doing work on behalf of <original user>"
examples:
Gateway receives Auth0 token for user@example.com with ["read:data"].
    Gateway creates delegated token for internal API service:

    ```python
    auth0_payload = await verify_auth0_token(external_token)
    internal_token = await create_delegated_token(
        original_payload=auth0_payload,
        actor_service="gateway-service",
        aud="internal-api"
    )
    # Result: {
    #   "sub": "user@example.com",
    #   "permissions": ["read:data"],  # Preserved from original
    #   "act": {"sub": "gateway-service"}
    # }
    ```

code.returnDescription:
Signed JWT token string with delegation claim

See Also:
    - RFC 8693: OAuth 2.0 Token Exchange
    - security.md: Service Delegation Pattern section

parameters.name: original_payload
parameters.description: The verified JWT payload from external auth (e.g., Auth0)

parameters.name: actor_service
parameters.description: Identifier of the service creating this delegated token

code.description: Verify and authorize a JWT token with policy enforcement.
code.name: check_auth

documentation.summary: Verify and authorize a JWT token with policy enforcement.

code.returnDescription: AuthUser if valid and authorized, None otherwise

code.description: Fluent builder for creating authorization policies.
code.name: policy

documentation.summary: Fluent builder for creating authorization policies.

code.description: Sign a JWT token with HS512 or EdDSA algorithm.
code.name: sign

documentation.summary: Sign a JWT token with HS512 or EdDSA algorithm.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Claims to include in the token (can include custom claims beyond standard JWT fields)

code.description: Parsed JWT token structure.
code.name: ParsedJwt

documentation.summary: Parsed JWT token structure.
documentation.details:
Result of parsing a JWT without verification. Useful for inspecting claims
before verification (e.g., routing decisions) or debugging token issues.
Never trust the payload from parse() alone - always verify() for security-sensitive operations.

code.description: Parse a JWT token into header and payload without verification.
code.name: parse

documentation.summary: Parse a JWT token into header and payload without verification.

code.description: Check if JWT payload will expire within specified seconds.
code.name: is_expiring_soon

documentation.summary: Check if JWT payload will expire within specified seconds.

code.returnDescription: True if token expires within the threshold

code.description: Map OAuth scopes to permission strings.
code.name: map_scopes_to_permissions

documentation.summary: Map OAuth scopes to permission strings.

code.returnDescription: List of permission strings (currently identity mapping)

code.description: Verify a JWT token with HS512 or EdDSA algorithm.
code.name: verify

documentation.summary: Verify a JWT token with HS512 or EdDSA algorithm.

code.returnDescription: Decoded payload if valid, None otherwise
